title: Paul Faulquemont
text:
Pierre-Charles Lamarle also known as Paul Faulquemont or Paul de Faulquemont (<a href="Metz">Metz</a>, 14 October 1805 (22 vendémiaire an XIV – <a href="19th%20arrondissement%20of%20Paris">19th arrondissement of Paris</a>, 15 Decembre 1872) was a 19th-century <a href="Theatre%20in%20France">French playwright</a> and journalist.
Biography.
It is unclear when and under what circumstances this son of an attorney to the trial court for Metz embarked on a career as a journalist in Paris. Still, he became editor of "L'Europe théâtrale" and "La France industrielle" and collaborated with many Parisian newspapers, including "L'Indépendance dramatique" and "Le Tintamarre" by <a href="Touchatout">Touchatout</a>.
He also authored dramas and comedies, mostly written in collaboration and only part of which has been printed.
When he died aged 67, his obituary in the 23 February issue of "Le Tintamarre" was written by its director and chief editor, <a href="L%C3%A9on%20Bienvenu">Léon Bienvenu</a>
